channel.title: Please help me with corridor setup
channel.description: Which net-vm do I need for the sys-corridor qube? It is not described in the Wiki. Probably sys-whonix, but I'd rather be sure. What about the "provides network" option?

item.title: Please help me with corridor setup
item.dc:creator: do23bf7m
item.source: Please help me with corridor setup

item.title: Please help me with corridor setup
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Could you please update documentation if you have a chance?

Whonix – 7 Aug 20

Using corridor, a Tor traffic whitelisting gateway with Whonix ™

Using corridor, a Tor traffic whitelisting gateway with Whonix

do23bf7m:

The created path is whonix-ws-15 (Whonix Workstation) -> sys corridor -> sys-whonix (Whonix Gateway) -> sys firewall -> sys-net

No

anon-whonix -> sys-whonix -> sys-corridor -> sys-firewall -> sys-net

Read full topic
item.source: Please help me with corridor setup

item.title: Please help me with corridor setup
item.dc:creator: do23bf7m
item.description:
#Create a new qube
Name: sys-corridor
Type: standalone
Template: Debian (or Debian Minimal)
Networking: sys-whonix
Advanced: CHECK ‘provides network’

Are these the right settings?

And whonix-ws-15 netvm is then sys-corrdior?
The created path is whonix-ws-15 (Whonix Workstation) -> sys corridor -> sys-whonix (Whonix Gateway) -> sys firewall -> sys-net

Please confirm the correctness.

Read full topic
item.source: Please help me with corridor setup

item.title: Please help me with corridor setup
item.dc:creator: 90WUVLight
item.description:
Corridor works as a filter, so it should be put between gateway and workstation. sys-whonix <- sys-corridor <- whonix workstation
You need to enable provides network option so whonix workstation can use it as netvm.

Read full topic
item.source: Please help me with corridor setup
